newsitem.title: USA: LCRA sees 550 MW Texas unit up in several days.
newsitem.headline: LCRA sees 550 MW Texas unit up in several days.

text.p: Lower Colorado River Authority (LCRA) said Wednesday the 550 megawatt Fayette coal-fired power unit 1 was likely to return to service in the next several days following a maintenance outage.
"They are going through the first steps to bring it back up. It should be on line in the next several days," an LCRA spokesman said.
The La Grange, Texas, unit was idled the weekend of Oct 6 for scheduled maintenance.
Fayette units 1 and 2, also rated at 550 megawatts, are equally owned by LCRA and the city of Austin.
